moves.1... g6: to free the way for the bishop and preparing for early castling.
moves.2... Nf6: developing the knight and preparing for early castling.
moves.3. Nc3 Bg7: developing the bishop and to have a strong defending position after castling.
moves.4. e4: to fully control the center and attacking the black knight after advancing to e5.
moves.6. h3: to get red of the pinning.
moves.8... h6: to force the bishop to be away.
moves.9. Bh4 c6 10. Bd3 Qb6: preparing for Qxb2 and attacking rock and knight in the same time. good move
moves.11... Qxb2: attacking rock and knight with check in both cases.
moves.12. O-O: to protect the rock but the knight is in danger.
moves.12... dxe5: to get red of this threat first.
moves.14... Qd4 15. dxc6 bxc6 16. Qxc6: attacking the rock and threatening check mate.
moves.16... O-O: castling just in the right time. good move
moves.17... Nxf6: i could capture the bishop with my bishop or with pawn ( exf6 ) or with my knight, i captured it with my knight to put it in a safer place.
moves.18. Rcd1: preparing for Bxg6 and attacking the queen.
moves.20. Be2 Qe5 21. Rac1 Qc5 22. Kh1: bad move because it left the pawn in f2 unprotected.
moves.24. c5: bad move, it is protected with one ( the rock ) and attacked by two ( the queen and the rock )
moves.26. Rxc5: very bad move, now white rock is protected by one (the queen) and attacked by two (queen and rock).
moves.26... Qxc5: yes with the queen not with the rock because i am leeding with +5 and i don't want the rock to be pinned,  any way it was a gift.
moves.27. Qa6 Rb8 28. Bc4 e6 29. Bb3 Nh5: good move, to put the knight in action ( one move to check the king ) and to open the way to the bishop.
moves.30... Ng3+: good move, white king has one square to move to.
moves.31. Kh2 Be5: good move, putting more pressure on the king.
moves.33. Kh1 Nc3: very good move, forking queen and rock this is the main power of a knight.
moves.35. Qxd1 Qd4:
to be in this square (d4) two strategical or tactical aims :
1. the strategical one is to get a chance for check mate.
2. the tactical one is to exchange queens because i am leading ( +7 ).
moves.36. Qg4:
now white trying to prevent check mate ( Qd1# or Qa1# ) by his queen and his bishop together,
so i have to get red of one of them to be very closer to check mate.
moves.36... Rxb3: i could not get red of his queen, but i could easily do by scarifying my rock. very good move.
moves.37. axb3 Qa1+:
now it is check, but it is one very easy step to check mate.
At this position my opponent resigned. conclusion : 1- my opponent is a good chess player, he made a mistake, but we all make mistakes. 2- annotation is a very hard job, i hope that my friend the reader will appreciate what i have done and may be the beginners will learn some thing. 3- your advice and comments will be appreciated with my thanks. 4- i like you all. 5- thank you. 6- a lot of thanks to GameKnot. friend of all Mustafa
